page.title: 15Fashions,West Tytherley
page.content: Forty people,mostly teenage girls, were asked about fashions.Almost half the girls and one of the boys had their ears pierced. All the teenagers had jeans which they wore often.They were matched with T_shirts. It was fashionable to have some form of radio, tape recorder or record player.One third had personal_stereo radios but most had portable radios of some kind. More than half owned a record player ; cassette recorders were not so popular.People prefer disks or records to tapes though many have both.The most popular recording group was WHAM!.A fashion with school pupils was to ride BMX bicycles and to have roller boots. Some teenagers have hair dyed unusual colours-pink,green,blue,multi but not many in the village.
